item.title: BabyReasoningBench: Generating Developmentally-Inspired Reasoning Tasks for Evaluating Baby Language Models
item.description: arXiv:2601.18933v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Traditional evaluations of reasoning capabilities of language models are dominated by adult-centric benchmarks that presuppose broad world knowledge, complex instruction following, and mature pragmatic competence. These assumptions are mismatched to b...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> instruction, model, arxiv, RAG, GPT | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: RIFT: Reordered Instruction Following Testbed To Evaluate Instruction Following in Singular Multistep Prompt Structures
item.description: arXiv:2601.18924v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large Language Models (LLMs) are increasingly relied upon for complex workflows, yet their ability to maintain flow of instructions remains underexplored. Existing benchmarks conflate task complexity with structural ordering, making it difficult to is...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> instruction, prompt, LLM, model, arxiv | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: Length-Adaptive Interest Network for Balancing Long and Short Sequence Modeling in CTR Prediction
item.description: arXiv:2601.19142v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: User behavior sequences in modern recommendation systems exhibit significant length heterogeneity, ranging from sparse short-term interactions to rich long-term histories. While longer sequences provide more context, we observe that increasing the max...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> context, prompt, experiment, model, framework | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: Context-Engineering - "Context engineering is the delicate art and science of filling the context window with just the right information for the next step." — Andrej Karpathy. A frontier, first-principles handbook inspired by Karpathy and 3Blue1Brown for moving beyond prompt engineering to the wider discipline of context design, orchestration, and optimization.
item.description: "Context engineering is the delicate art and science of filling the context window with just the right information for the next step." — Andrej Karpathy.
